channel.title: Batch help
channel.description:
Alright, I am working on a batch file that will allow me to open up files by entering in a number. Here is an example of how I want it to look:
Mastrchief's File Opener V 1.0 Select the number that matches the file you wish to open So if 1 is Firefox and you want firefox, type in '1' and hit enter Still in beta 1 - Firefox 2 - Internet Explorer 3 - To exit out of the program. Choose an option..
So, I have it looking like that, so thats all good. My problem is that when I select something, it doesn't loop back to the beginning, it moves on to the next piece of code. How would I go about looping it back the beginning. Heres my code so far: [code]@echo off title Mastrchief's File Opener V 1.0 echo Select the number that matches the file you wish to open echo So if 1 is Firefox and you want firefox, type in '1' and hit enter echo Now choose a program! echo. echo 1 - Firefox echo 2 - Internet Explorer echo 3 - Exit out of this program. echo. echo. set /p c=Option: if %c%==1 goto 1 if %c%==2 goto 2 if %c%==3 goto 3 :1 START "" /MAX firefox.exe[/code] If someone could give me a tip, that would be great. EDIT: I think I figured it out, and it seems to work.... Sorta.. I added :START to the beginning and after START "' /MAX whatever.exe I added goto :START. Is there any way to instead of see this: [img]http://img521.imageshack.us/img521/7729/batchit2.png[/img] Have it just show the original menu? I have figured it out. All I need is the question below answered. Also,how do make it so when people don't select a number and just hit enter, it gives them a message that they need to select a number instead of just opening the first option?

item.title: Batch help
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

To answer your last queston about people not hitting a number.

First make a :warning or something

then at the end of

set /p c=Option: 
if %c%==1 goto 1
if %c%==2 goto 2
if %c%==3 goto 3

add goto warning at the bottom

set /p c=Option: 
if %c%==1 goto 1
if %c%==2 goto 2
if %c%==3 goto 3
goto warning

so the next available thing left for it to do is go to the warning menu, then at the warning menu just have it display your message, pause, and then have it take them back to the main menu

item.title: Batch help
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

i would do something like this

[code]@echo off
title Mastrchief’s File Opener V 1.0

:mainmenu
cls
echo Select the number that matches the file you wish to open
echo So if 1 is Firefox and you want firefox, type in ‘1’ and hit enter
echo Now choose a program!
echo.
echo 1 - Firefox
echo 2 - Internet Explorer
echo 3 - Exit out of this program.
echo.
echo.

set /p c=Option: 
if %c%==1 goto 1
if %c%==2 goto 2
if %c%==3 goto 3

goto mainmenu

:1
“C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe”
goto mainmenu
:2
“C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe”
goto mainmenu
:3
exit
goto mainmenu[/code]
